sentence.Network_en: The hecklers pelted the discombobulated speaker with anything that came to hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些激烈质问者拿起手边的任何东西向惊慌失措的演讲者扔去.

sentence.Network_en: I get completely discombobulated when I work figures that big.
sentence.Network_cn: 当我计算那么大一笔数时,我完全糊涂了.

sentence.Network_en: Her plans were discombobulated by the turn of events.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的计划因为事件的变化而陷于混乱.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE词汇精选（核心词汇） ... discombobulate 扰乱，使困惑 discombobulated 扰乱的，打乱的 discomfit 使懊恼；使难堪.
jack withdiscombobulated 使混乱;破坏,打乱计划leave somebody in the lurch 在某人需要帮助时弃之不顾.

list.abs: 英语反义词 - 豆丁网 ... discharge 解雇>雇佣 discombobulate 扰乱>调解 discommode 使为难>施恩惠.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(D) ... discolorment 变色 discombobulate 使混乱 discomfiture 挫折.

means.word_mean: 1. having self-possession upset; thrown into confusion;

sentences.sentence: "the hecklers pelted the discombobulated speaker with anything that came to hand"
"looked at each other dumbly, quite disconcerted"- G.B.Shaw

auth_sentence.content: But you are discombobulated, to the point of confusing ontogeny with evolution that never occurs in an individual organism!
